alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City and Borough of Yakutat; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Municipality of Skagway; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 6:46AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS AND HEAVY RAIN THROUGH THE DAYTIME MONDAY... A front with an embedded surface low is tracking over the region. Wind gusts of 50 to 60 mph and periods of heavy rain with total amounts as high as 2 inches are expected. Peak winds and rain will occur with the front over the southern half of the panhandle during the daylight hours. Behind the front, a wind shift to the SW is expected through the late afternoon. A high wind warning is in effect for a portion of this area, please see your local point forecast for greater details. Rainfall rates and totals are on the lower end for landslide concerns, however with the wind shift this afternoon, the potential cannot be ruled out. After the front passes conditions will improve quickly. Another stronger system will affect in the area Wednesday and Thursday bringing more impactful weather. Strong winds during peak astronomical high tides both afternoons may cause coastal flooding.
